Brief description: Posts from age-specific online chat rooms.
Preprocessing: Hand privacy masked, tagged for part of speech and dialogue-act.
Reference: Forsyth, E., Lin, J., & Martell, C. (2008, June 25). The NPS Chat Corpus. Retrieved from
Creator: Forsyth, E., Lin, J., & Martell, C.

Reference: Alessandro Sordoni, Michel Galley, Michael Auli, Chris Brockett, Yangfeng Ji, Meg Mitchell, Jian-Yun Nie, Jianfeng Gao, and Bill Dolan, A Neural Network Approach to Context-Sensitive Generation of Conversational Responses, Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics â€“ Human Language Technologies (NAACL-HLT 2015), June 2015.
Creator: Sordini, A. et al.

Preprocessing: Anonymized e-mails and URLs. Omitted documents with lengths <500 words or >500,000 words, or that were <90% English.
Reference: Shaoul, C. & Westbury C. (2013) A reduced redundancy USENET corpus (2005-2011)  Edmonton, AB: University of Alberta (downloaded from )
Creator: Shaoul, C., & Westbury C.

Brief description: SMS messages collected between two users, with timing analysis.
Reference: KAN, M. (2011, January). NUS Short Message Service (SMS) Corpus. Retrieved from
Creator: KAN, M

Reference: Stuck_In_the_Matrix. (2015, July 3). I have every publicly available Reddit comment for research. ~ 1.7 billion comments @ 250 GB compressed. Any interest in this? [Original post]. Message posted to

Brief description: Dialogues extracted from Ubuntu chat stream on IRC.
Reference: Ryan Lowe, Nissan Pow, Iulian V. Serban and Joelle Pineau, "The Ubuntu Dialogue Corpus: A Large Dataset for Research in Unstructure Multi-Turn Dialogue Systems", SIGDial 2015.
Creator: Lowe, R. et al.
